name: insusceptible
content:
insusceptible adjective
(NOT INFLUENCED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not easily influenced or affected by something: insusceptible to These tiny creatures seem to be insusceptible to antibiotics. Even the boring world of accountancy is not insusceptible to a little glamour from time to time.
More examplesFewer examplesThe disease is caused by a fungus that is insusceptible to the standard treatments.Even people who have been vaccinated are still not completely insusceptible to the new strain of the virus.

insusceptible adjective
(NOT POSSIBLE)
[ after verb ] formal If an idea or statement is insusceptible, it is not able to be understood, proved, explained, etc. in a particular way: insusceptible of The decision is insusceptible of judicial review. It was just a stream of incoherent images that was wholly insusceptible of rational interpretation.
